sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"行为，行动"之意。
means: act ：一般指具体的、短暂的或个别的行为，强调行为的完成及其效果。
action ：普通用词，着重行动的过程。
deed ：较庄重用词，除泛指各种行为外，还可用于指某种高尚或伟大的行为，故常译作"功绩，业绩"。
operation ：多指一连串行动或行为的完成方式。
performance ：主要指行动的方式方法。

stems_affixes.word_buile: oper工作+able能……的→能工作[操作,手术]的
operation操作+al……的→adj.操作的, 运作的
co共同+operation操作→共同操作→合作
oper工作+a→通过工作[创作]而来

stems_affixes.value_cn: 运转,开动,操作,手术,运算,经营
stems_affixes.word_buile: operate[v.操作,运转,开动,起作用,动手术]+ion表名词→n.运转,开动,操作,手术,运算,经营

stems_affixes.value_cn: 操作,运转,开动,起作用,动手术

means.word_mean: 业务,经营,交易,投机买卖

entry.def: An operation is a highly organized activity that involves many people doing different things.
entry.tran: （由大量人员参与、具有高度组织性的）活动，行动，工作

example.ex: The rescue operation began on Friday afternoon...
example.tran: 救援行动于星期五下午开始。

example.ex: The soldiers were engaged in a military operation close to the Ugandan border.
example.tran: 这些士兵参加了乌干达边境附近的一次军事行动。

entry.def: A business or company can be referred to as an operation .

example.ex: Thorn's electronics operation employs around 5,000 people...
example.tran: 索恩的电子公司雇用了约5,000名员工。

example.ex: The two parent groups now run their business as a single combined operation.
example.tran: 这两个母公司现在合并为一家企业经营业务。

entry.def: When a patient has an operation, a surgeon cuts open their body in order to remove, replace, or repair a diseased or damaged part.

example.ex: Charles was at the clinic recovering from an operation on his arm.
example.tran: 查尔斯的胳膊动了手术，正在这家诊所进行康复治疗。

entry.def: If a system is in operation, it is being used.

example.ex: Until the rail links are in operation, passengers can only travel through the tunnel by coach.
example.tran: 在铁路连线开通之前，乘客只能乘坐长途客车穿越隧道。

example.ex: ...the free banking system that has been in operation since the early eighties.
example.tran: 从80年代初就开始实行的自由银行制度

entry.def: If a machine or device is in operation, it is working.

example.ex: There are three ski lifts in operation.

entry.def: When a rule, system, or plan comes into operation or you put it into operation, you begin to use it.

example.ex: The Financial Services Act came into operation four years ago...
example.tran: 《金融服务法》于4年前开始实施。

example.ex: Cheaper energy conservation techniques have been put into operation in the developed world.
example.tran: 更经济的节能技术在发达国家已经投入使用。

means.word_mean: 1. a business especially one run on a large scale;

sentences.sentence: "a large-scale farming operation"
"a multinational operation"
"they paid taxes on every stage of the operation"
"they had to consolidate their operations"

means.word_mean: 2. a planned activity involving many people performing various actions;

sentences.sentence: "they organized a rescue operation"
"the biggest police operation in French history"
"running a restaurant is quite an operation"
"consolidate the companies various operations"

means.word_mean: 3. a process or series of acts especially of a practical or mechanical nature involved in a particular form of work;

sentences.sentence: "the operations in building a house"
"certain machine tool operations"

means.word_mean: 4. the state of being in effect or being operative;

sentences.sentence: "that rule is no longer in operation"

means.word_mean: 5. a medical procedure involving an incision with instruments; performed to repair damage or arrest disease in a living body;

sentences.sentence: "they will schedule the operation as soon as an operating room is available"
"he died while undergoing surgery"

means.word_mean: 6. activity by a military or naval force (as a maneuver or campaign);

sentences.sentence: "it was a joint operation of the navy and air force"

means.word_mean: 7. (computer science) data processing in which the result is completely specified by a rule (especially the processing that results from a single instruction);

sentences.sentence: "it can perform millions of operations per second"

means.word_mean: 8. process or manner of functioning or operating;

sentences.sentence: "the power of its engine determine its operation"
"the plane's operation in high winds"
"they compared the cooking performance of each oven"
"the jet's performance conformed to high standards"
"the problems at the end of the chapter demonstrated the mathematical processes involved in the derivation"
"they were learning the basic operations of arithmetic"

means.word_mean: 10. (psychology) the performance of some composite cognitive activity; an operation that affects mental contents;

sentences.sentence: "the process of thinking"
"the cognitive operation of remembering"

means.word_mean: 11. the activity of operating something (a machine or business etc.);

sentences.sentence: "her smooth operation of the vehicle gave us a surprisingly comfortable ride"

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: via Old French from Latin operatio(n-), from the verb operari 'expend labour on' (see operate)
